definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
number 20 of the 28 constellations 二十八宿, approx. Orion 獵戶座|猎户座
variant of 嘴, mouth/beak/spout (of teapot etc)
mouth/CL:張|张[zhang1]/slap in the face/CL:個|个[ge4]
to open one's mouth (to speak, esp. to make a request)/to gape
a full mouth of (sth physical)/to have the mouth exclusively filled with (a certain language, lies, promises, etc)
Shut up!/same as 閉上嘴巴|闭上嘴巴
lively discussion with everybody talking at once
Shizuishan prefecture level city in Ningxia on the border with Inner Mongolia
to interrupt (sb talking)/to butt in/to cut into a conversation
(bird species of China) black-headed gull (Chroicocephalus ridibundus)

sentences.english: He came in, holding a cigarette between his lips.
sentences.chinese: 他嘴上叨着香菸走了進來。

sentences.english: Why don't you wish on the gargoyle?
sentences.chinese: 你不爲什麼不向怪獸的滴水嘴許願？

sentences.english: Tell that child to stop pouting.
sentences.chinese: 叫那孩子別撅着嘴撒嬌。

sentences.english: He completely monopolized the conversation last night; Mary and I couldn't get a word in edgeways.
sentences.chinese: 他昨晚滔滔不絕地講話，瑪麗和我完全插不上嘴。

sentences.english: She bent her mouth to the tap and drank the tepid water.
sentences.chinese: 她把嘴伸到水龍頭底下去喝那微溫的水。

sentences.english: They mince and prim and pout.
sentences.chinese: 她們矯揉造作，一本正經還撅着嘴。

sentences.english: The Toucan has a large yellow and black beak and blue striped wings.
sentences.chinese: 犀鳥款有一個黃色和黑色的嘴和藍色條紋的翅膀。

sentences.english: Lisette 's large red mouth broke into a most alluring smile.
sentences.chinese: 莉莎特的鮮紅的大嘴露出了一副極爲誘人的微笑。

sentences.english: But more mouthed along listlessly or stared in silence.
sentences.chinese: 但更多的人只是無精打采地張着嘴或默默地發呆。

sentences.english: Her delicate face flushed pink, her lips pouted softly, as if she were going to cry.
sentences.chinese: 她的臉激動的發紅，輕輕地撅着嘴，彷彿要哭似的。

sentences.english: Mr. Swiveller looked, as he was, all open mouthed astonishment.
sentences.chinese: 斯威夫勒先生驚異得張開了嘴。

sentences.english: Her lips were sealed by a promise.
Czeslaw tore the cigarette out of Piotr’s mouth.
sentences.chinese: 切斯沃夫從彼得亞雷的嘴上一把扯下香菸。
一位年輕的士兵，張着嘴，光着頭。

sentences.english: She covered her mouth with her hand, another wave of chills flowing over her as her knees literally knocked together.
sentences.chinese: 她用手捂住嘴，又一陣惡寒讓她全身發抖，膝蓋打顫。

sentences.english: Never jerk the horse's mouth while making any of the movements with the saber.
sentences.chinese: 當用馬刀進行每一次刺出時，不要猛拉馬的嘴。

definition: mouth/CL:張|张[zhang1]/slap in the face/CL:個|个[ge4]
tongue/CL:個|个[ge4]/enemy soldier captured for the purpose of extracting information
to open one's mouth (to speak, esp. to make a request)/to gape
lit. cherry mouth (idiom)/fig. a delicate, ruby-lipped mouth
